entities: United Nations Integrated Office in Burundi (BINUB)
reporting_cycle: The Secretary-General reports regularly to the Council on the implementation of the present resolution
summary:
The Council urges BINUB to consider the rights of women and gender considerations in all areas, and requests the Secretary-General to report on progress on gender mainstreaming.

The Council also stresses the need for cooperation between BINUB and the United Nations Organization Mission in the Democratic Republic of the Congo.

It welcomes the recommendation that the Integrated Office be headed by an Executive Representative of the Secretary-General, and takes note of benchmarks for gauging progress made by BINUB.

The Council emphasizes that the Government of Burundi bears primary responsibility for peacebuilding, security, and long-term development, and urges international donors to support the Government's efforts.

It urges the authorities and all political actors in Burundi to pursue reforms agreed upon at Arusha and Dar-es-Salaam, and to maintain dialogue and consensus-building.

The Council also calls upon the Burundian authorities to investigate alleged human rights violations, and to ensure that those responsible are brought to justice.

It requests the Secretary-General to keep the Security Council regularly informed of progress made in establishing BINUB and to report regularly on the implementation of the resolution. 

The Council decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
